name: 3D objects
excerpt: Bring your teaching to life with 3D scans of objects from the museum collection.

name: Animation gallery introduction
excerpt: This video will help you prepare for a visit to the Animation gallery at the National Science and Media Museum, Bradford.

name: Bottle top shapes
excerpt: Get creative with geometry by drawing lines on bottle tops and seeing what shapes you can make.

name: Bubble Fun!
excerpt: Explore mixtures and materials by making brilliant bubbles!

name: Build a Dome
excerpt: Use straws and strong shapes to make a self supporting dome.

name: Building greenhouse gases
excerpt: Discover which gases are greenhouse gases and how they affect Earth’s energy budget.

name: Can you lift something heavier than yourself? – 7 questions: film 7
excerpt: This video will help your students explore pulleys and make creative connections between forces, literacy, PE, history, art and design.

name: Carbon Cycle Caper
excerpt: Learn about how the climate cycle has been affected by our use of fossil fuels since the Industrial Revolution.

name: Chatterbox Challenge
excerpt: Create a chatterbox to help you explore the amazing objects in Science Museum.

name: Climate report
excerpt: Find out the difference between weather and climate, and consider the impact of climate change on people’s lifestyles.

name: Discussion formats
excerpt: A great way for students to explore the science that relates to their lives.

name: Do you see what I see? – 7 questions: film 3
excerpt: This video will help your students explore mirrors and make creative connections between light, colour, biology, art and literacy.

name: Do you want to know a secret?
excerpt: An activity representing a genetic test, in which students receive a sealed box containing a chance card.

name: Ear Gongs
excerpt: Use coat hangers and string to investigate sound, vibrations and materials.

name: Eco living
excerpt: Punk Science man Dan shows us how to save energy and resources and look cool at the same time.

name: Electrifying Electricity trail
excerpt: Lead your pupils on a trail exploring the exhibits in our galleries that relate to the topic of electricity.

name: Engineer Your Future: teachers’ resource pack
excerpt: Help students explore the skills used by engineers and gain a better understanding of careers in engineering.

excerpt: This video will help you prepare for a visit to the Exploring Space gallery at the Science Museum, London.

name: Flight gallery introduction
excerpt: This video will help you prepare for a visit to the Flight gallery at the Science Museum, London.

name: Getting everyone involved

name: Google Expeditions
excerpt: Take your students on a virtual school trip to a selection of galleries at the Science Museum, London.

name: Graphite Circuits
excerpt: Turn your drawings into circuits using the conductive properties of graphite.

excerpt: This video will help you prepare for a visit to the Great Hall at the National Railway Museum, York.

name: Great Object Hunt: Explorer
excerpt: This treasure-hunt-style activity encourages discussion about how science and technology have shaped our lives.

name: Great Object Hunt: Forces
excerpt: Students explore the galleries and work together to choose an object for each challenge.

name: Great Object Hunt: Health
excerpt: An activity to help students explore the galleries and work together to choose an object for each challenge.

name: Great Object Hunt: Materials
excerpt: Students explore the Science Museum's galleries and work together to choose an object for each challenge.

excerpt: Students follow their curiosity and work together while exploring the world around them.

name: Great Object Hunt: Waves and Communication
excerpt: Students explore the galleries and work together to choose an object for each challenge.

name: Healthy living
excerpt: Punk Science experiment on living volunteers to explore the brain chemicals that keep us healthy.

name: How to punk your science
excerpt: Our Punk Science team share their tips for adding extra fizz to your science teaching.

name: Image bank: Tim Peake’s spacecraft
excerpt: Images of Tim Peake's spacecraft and his journey to the International Space Station.

name: InfoAge+ App
excerpt: Get more from your visit to the Science Museum's amazing Information Age gallery.

excerpt: This video will help you prepare for a visit to the Information Age gallery at the Science Museum, London.

name: Instant Ice Cream

name: Kodak gallery introduction
excerpt: This video will help you prepare for a visit to the Kodak gallery at the National Science and Media Museum, Bradford.

name: Launchball
excerpt: Spring your way through 30 obstacle-filled levels and create your own levels to play and share with friends.

name: Magnetic Maze
excerpt: Use a magnet to guide objects through a maze drawn on the side of a plastic bottle.

name: Make it fly
excerpt: Investigate the forces involved in how planes fly by making some of your own and testing them out!

excerpt: This video will help you prepare for a visit to Mathematics: The Winton Gallery at the Science Museum, London.

name: Medical trials
excerpt: Punk Science carry out their unique version of medical trials, showing how drugs are tested against a placebo.

name: Mystery objects
excerpt: A great way to get students talking and thinking, and to encourage observation and questioning skills.

name: Nanotechnology Song
excerpt: Use this catchy song about nanotechnology to get your students buzzing for a classroom discussion.

name: No Pressure

name: Periscope
excerpt: Use mirrors and paper to build your own periscope and see over walls!

name: Pinball machine
excerpt: Build your own pinball machine and use it to explore Newton's laws of motion while challenging your friends!

name: Polarising Pics
excerpt: Unleash your creative skills by using sticky tape and a digital screen to create colour changing art. Using a pair of 3D cinema specs your picture will come to life and reveal all the colours of the rainbow.

excerpt: Engage your students by linking topics they enjoy talking about with the content you need to teach.

name: Pregnant man
excerpt: Explore the social, medical and ethical implications of male pregnancy in a classroom discussion.

name: Rocket Mice
excerpt: Make a paper mouse fly like a rocket using a milk bottle and some air pressure!

name: Rocket mice
excerpt: Make a paper mouse fly like a rocket using a milk bottle and some air pressure.

excerpt: This Science Museum game allows you to design and test your own all-terrain space rover.

name: Selective breeding

excerpt: Put your engineering skills into practice by building a tall, strong tower out of spaghetti.
